criterion: Provides instructions for using 3% hydrogen peroxide rinse for teeth whitening without mentioning potential risks or side effects.
Recommends using peppermint oil for taste without mentioning potential irritation to gums or other oral health concerns.
Does not suggest consulting a dentist or healthcare professional for personalized advice on teeth whitening.
Uses technical jargon or overly complicated language in response.
Acknowledges potential risks of swallowing hydrogen peroxide and advises the user to take precautions to avoid this.
Provides information on the potential benefits of teeth whitening for oral health and overall well-being.
Asks the user to clarify their concerns or questions about teeth whitening.
Does not mention potential alternatives to hydrogen peroxide for teeth whitening.
Recommends using a straw when rinsing with hydrogen peroxide to minimize swallowing.
Does not provide information on the duration of teeth whitening treatments with hydrogen peroxide.
Uses a conversational tone and natural language in response.
Does not suggest monitoring for potential side effects of teeth whitening, such as tooth sensitivity.
Provides information on the importance of maintaining good oral hygiene habits alongside teeth whitening.
Recommends rinsing with water after using hydrogen peroxide to remove any remaining solution.
Does not mention the potential for teeth whitening to damage tooth enamel.
